COMMAND.name: quit
COMMAND.help: Quit this CLI session

COMMAND.name: top
COMMAND.help: Go back to the main CLI level

COMMAND.name: up
COMMAND.help: Go back to the previous CLI menu level

COMMAND.name: radio
COMMAND.help: This object describes a single physical radio within a specific AP

COMMAND.name: opclasses
COMMAND.help: This object describes one of the current operating classes in use by the radio. One operating class is indicated for each current operating bandwidth (e.g., 80, 40 and 20 MHz operating classes for a radio operating a BSS with supported bandwidth of 80 MHz). The channel indicated for the 20 MHz operating class is equal to the current primary channel.

COMMAND.name: cap
COMMAND.help: This object describes the capabilities of the radio which may be different from the current operational configuration.

COMMAND.name: capopclasses
COMMAND.help: Describes the list of all operating classes (selected from Table E-4 of [1]) supported by the radio.

COMMAND.name: notoper
COMMAND.help: List of channel numbers which are statically non-operable in the operating class (i.e. the radio is never able to operate on these channels - Other channels from this operating class which are not listed here are supported by the radio.).

COMMAND.name: bss
COMMAND.help: This object describes a single logical BSS operating on this radio

COMMAND.name: sta
COMMAND.help: This object describes a single STA.

COMMAND.name: bhsta
COMMAND.help: This object describes a Wi-Fi backhaul link used in a Multi-AP Agent.

COMMAND.name: scanres
COMMAND.help: The results of the latest scan for neighboring BSS by the radio.

COMMAND.name: scanresopclassscan
COMMAND.help: Radio Scab Result

COMMAND.name: chanscan
COMMAND.help: Radio Scab Result

COMMAND.name: neighbss
COMMAND.help: This object describes a neighbor BSS detected by channel scan.

COMMAND.name: radio show
COMMAND.help: Show information

PARAM.name: DeviceIndex
PARAM.help: DeviceIndex parameter: number, range ([n-m]) or wildcard(*) - by default

COMMAND.name: radio update
COMMAND.help: Update management objects information of the appropriated component
